intro: Stegania falcata, commonly known as the sickleleaf stegania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive sickle-shaped leaves, which are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the wet season. Stegania falcata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
